results.title: North and south
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “A History of British art”.
Episode two of ‘A History of British art’ looks at the brilliant, mad excessiveness of the Elizabethan visual imagination, in architecture, painting, gardening and language. Written and presented by Andrew Graham-Dixon.

results.title: North-west horizon
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and W. H. Shepherd
results.brief_description: The ports, mineral resources and industries of north-west Australia. Broome, with an overseas port, pearling, whaling, manganese; Port Hedland, Wittenem Gorge and asbestos mines; Derby, the cattle port; oil exploration, rice growing; iron ore at Yampi Sound; bean-growing at Caernavon; Wyndham and the beef industry; the role of aircraft in this area.

results.title: North-West Coastal Highway
results.brief_description: Shows how the Main Roads Department of Western Australia is completing a modern road from Carnarvon to Port Hedland as part of the National Highway number 1 encircling the continent. Explains some aspects of its effect on the development and prosperity of the area.

results.title: Normandy
results.brief_description: Normandy has an exciting past of conquest and liberation and is now a popular holiday destination. This tape takes in sights such as; the port of Dieppe, Mont St Michel, a cruise down the River Seine to the city of Rouen, Monet’s gardens at Giverny, the streets of Bayeaux, the countryside surrounding the Suisse Normande, the harbour at Honfleur, and on a more historical note visit the D-Day landing beaches and Caen, where William the Conqueror lies entombed.

results.title: Normandie-Niemen
results.creator_credit: Simon Mariakhine, Jean Dreville and Damir Viatich Berejnykh
results.brief_description:
In 1942, 16 French pilots decide to join forces with the Red Army and participate in the Battle of Stalingrad.

Credits: Producer, Simon Mariakhine ; directors, Jean Dreville, Damir Viatich Berejnykh ; writers, Charles Spaak, Elsa Triolet, Constantin Simonov ; photography, Jacques Natteau ; music, Rodeon Stchedrine.
Cast: Marc Cassot, Giani Esposito, Pierre Trabaud, Gerald Buhr, Georges Riviere.

results.title: Norman the doorman (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: Story of Norman the Doorman who lives in the basement of the art museum and faithfully guards the mousehole doorway to the museum. Norman makes a wire sculpture out of mousetraps and enters a sculpture contest in the museum. When he wins, Norman’s prize is a tour through the upstairs galleries.

results.title: Norman McLaren: Selected films. Creative process (Collectors edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Karen Marginson and Norman McLaren
results.brief_description: This collector’s edition DVD box set features 14 of famed filmmaker Norman McLaren’s animated works; a documentary entitled ‘Creative Process: Norman McLaren’ which explores his philosophy on cinema and creativity; and a companion 104 page booklet in French and English that contains technical notes on the featured films and extends the ideas espoused in ‘Creative Process’. The documentary and many of the featured films are also available on other formats in the ACMI collection.

results.title: Norman Loves Rose
results.creator_credit: Direct Hit Productions, Norman Films, Basil Appleby and Henri Safran
results.brief_description: Norman is a sensitive, precocious 13 year old preparing for his formal entry into Jewish manhood, the bar mitzvah. He is also passionately in love with his sister-in-law, Rose, who is pregnant. Stars Carol Kane, Tony Owen with Barry Otto, Sandy Gore and Warren Mitchell.

results.title: Norman Jewison, filmmaker
results.brief_description: Toronto-born Norman Jewison first gained prominence producing for Canadian television, then went on to greater success making Hollywood theatrical features. In this film he is seen directing a large international cast and crew in the film version of the musical hit Fiddler on the Roof. Between scenes, Jewison talks freely about many aspects of the film industry and some of his experiences in it. A candid study of a director in action.
